repairbox.artefact module¶

class repairbox.artefact.Artefact(source: repairbox.manager.Source, name: str, dataset: str, program: str, harness: repairbox.test.TestHarness, build_instructions: repairbox.build.BuildInstructions, compilation_instructions: repairbox.artefact.CompilationInstructions) → None¶

Bases: object

build(force=False) → None¶

Builds the Docker image for this artefact.

compilation_instructions¶
dataset¶

The dataset to which this artefact belongs.

download(force=False) → None¶

Attempts to download the Docker image for this artefact from DockerHub.

from_file(source: repairbox.manager.Source, fn: str) → repairbox.artefact.Artefact¶

Loads an artefact from its YAML manifest file.

harness¶

The test harness used by this artefact.

identifier¶

The fully-qualified name of this artefact.

image¶

The name of the Docker image for this artefact.

install(upgrade=False) → None¶
installed¶

Returns true if the Docker image for this artefact is installed onto the local machine.

launch() → None¶

Launches an interactive container for this artefact. Once the pseudotty session has ended, the container is destroyed.

provision(volumes=[], network_mode='bridge', ports={}, tty=False) → repairbox.container.BugContainer¶

Provisions a container for this artefact.

source¶

The source to which this artefact belongs.

source_dir¶
tests¶

The test suite used by this artefact.

uninstall(force=False, noprune=False) → None¶

Uninstalls all Docker images associated with this artefact.

repairbox.build module¶

class repairbox.build.BuildInstructions(src: repairbox.manager.Source, root: str, tag: str, context: str, filename: str, arguments: dict, depends_on: str) → None¶

Bases: object

Used to store instructions on how to build a Docker image.

TODO: only allow relative, forward roots

abs_context¶
arguments¶

A dictionary of build-time arguments provided during the construction of the Docker image associated with these instructions.

build(force=False, quiet=False) → None¶

Constructs the Docker image described by these instructions.

context¶
depends_on¶

The name of the Docker image that the construction of the image associated with these build instructions depends on. If no such dependency exists, None is returned.

file¶

The path to the Dockerfile used to build the image associated with these instructions, relative to the location of the build instruction file.

file_abs¶
static from_file(src: repairbox.manager.Source, fn: str) → repairbox.build.BuildInstructions¶

Loads a set of build instructions belonging to a given source from a specified YAML file.

static from_yaml(src: repairbox.manager.Source, root: str, yml: dict)¶

Indicates whether this image is installed to the local machine.

repairbox.container module¶

class repairbox.container.BugContainer(bug: repairbox.artefact.Artefact, volumes=[], network_mode='bridge', ports={}, tty=False) → None¶

Bases: object

alive¶
bug¶

The bug inside this container.

compile(mode='default', verbose=True)¶

Attempts to compile the program inside this container.

TODO: check for failure

container¶

The Docker container underlying this proxy.

copy_to(source_fn, dest_fn)¶

Copies a given file from the host machine to a specified location inside this container.

destroy()¶
execute(test)¶

Executes a given test inside this container and returns the result of that execution.

execute_command(cmd, context='/', stdout=True, stderr=False, block=True)¶

Returns a tuple containing the exit code, execution duration, and output, respectively.

logs(stream=False)¶
mount_file(src, dest, mode)¶

Dynamically mounts a given file (or directory) inside this container.

https://jpetazzo.github.io/2015/01/13/docker-mount-dynamic-volumes/

patch()¶

Apply a patch to the source code.

reset()¶

Resets the state of this bug container.

spectra()¶

Computes and returns the spectra for this bug.

class repairbox.coverage.CoverageReport(files: typing.Dict[str, repairbox.coverage.FileCoverageReport]) → None¶

Bases: object

Attributes:
__files (dict: str -> FileCoverageReport): a dictionary mapping the
names of files contained within this report to their individual coverage reports.
file(name: str) → repairbox.coverage.FileCoverageReport¶
files¶

A list of the names of the files that are included in this report.

static from_string(s: str) → repairbox.coverage.CoverageReport¶
static from_xml(root: xml.etree.ElementTree.Element) → repairbox.coverage.CoverageReport¶
class repairbox.coverage.FileCoverageReport(fileName: str, lines: typing.Dict[int, int]) → None¶

Bases: object

hits(num: int) → int¶

Returns the number of times that a line with a given number was executed.

lines¶

A list of the lines that are included in this report.

was_hit(num: int) → bool¶

Determines whether a line with a given number was executed at least once during the execution(s).

Checks whether a bug with a given identifier is provided by this source.

Downloads this source to disk.

manager¶
rel_path¶

Returns the location of this source, relative to the sources directory.

remove() → None¶

Removes the files for this source from disk, and uninstalls all associated Docker images. This should only be called by SourceManager.

scan() → None¶
update() → None¶

Downloads any updates to the files for this source.

class repairbox.manager.SourceManager(manager: repairbox.manager.RepairBoxManager) → None¶

Bases: object

Attributes:
__rbox (RepairBox): __sources_filename (str): __sources (dict of str to str):
add(src: str) → None¶

Adds a new source.

path¶

The path to the sources directory on disk.

reload() → None¶
remove(src: str) → None¶

Removes an existing source. The removal process destroys the local copies of the manifest (and build) files for this source, and uninstalls all of its associated images.

sources¶
update() → None¶

Downloads any available updates for all (installed) sources.

repairbox.spectra module¶

class repairbox.spectra.FileSpectra(line_to_spectra: typing.Dict[int, repairbox.spectra.LineSpectra]) → None¶

Bases: object

static from_coverage(passing: typing.List[repairbox.coverage.FileCoverageReport], failing: typing.List[repairbox.coverage.FileCoverageReport]) → repairbox.spectra.FileSpectra¶
lines¶

A list of the numbers of the lines that are included in this spectra.

class repairbox.spectra.LineSpectra(ep: int, ef: int, np: int, nf: int) → None¶

Bases: object

Summarises the coverage information for a single line in the program in terms of the number of passing and failing tests that do and do not cover it, respectively.

ef¶

The number of failing tests that cover this line.

ep¶

The number of passing tests that cover this line.

nf¶

The number of failing tests that do not cover this line.

np¶

The number of passing tests that do not cover this line.

class repairbox.spectra.Spectra(file_to_spectra: typing.Dict[str, repairbox.spectra.FileSpectra]) → None¶

Bases: object

files¶

A list of the names of the files that are included in this spectra.

static from_coverage(passing: typing.List[repairbox.coverage.CoverageReport], failing: typing.List[repairbox.coverage.CoverageReport]) → repairbox.spectra.Spectra¶
